com.gh.bmd.jrt.routine

Interface ObjectRoutineBuilder

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ClassRoutineBuilder, ConfigurableBuilder, SharableBuilder

    public interface ObjectRoutineBuilder
extends ClassRoutineBuilder
    Interface defining a builder of routines wrapping an object instance.

    Note that only instance methods can be asynchronously invoked through the routines created by this builder.

    Created by davide on 3/7/15.

    See Also:
    Bind, Pass, Share, Timeout, Wrap

    • Method Detail

      • buildProxy

        @Nonnull
<TYPE> TYPE buildProxy(@Nonnull
                             Class<TYPE> itf)
        Returns a proxy object enabling asynchronous calling of the target instance methods.

        The routines used for calling the methods will honor the attributes specified in any optional Bind and Timeout annotation.
        In case the wrapped object does not implement the specified interface, the binding annotation value will be used to bind the interface method with the instance ones. If no annotation is present, the method name will be used instead to map it.
        The interface will be interpreted as a mirror of the target object methods, and the optional Pass annotations will be honored.
        Note that such annotations will override any configuration set through the builder.

        Type Parameters:
        TYPE - the interface type.
        Parameters:
        itf - the interface implemented by the return object.
        Returns:
        the proxy object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified class does not represent an interface.
        NullPointerException - if the specified class is null.

      • buildProxy

        @Nonnull
<TYPE> TYPE buildProxy(@Nonnull
                             ClassToken<TYPE> itf)
        Returns a proxy object enabling asynchronous calling of the target instance methods.

        The routines used for calling the methods will honor the attributes specified in any optional Bind and Timeout annotation.
        In case the wrapped object does not implement the specified interface, the binding annotation value will be used to bind the interface method with the instance ones. If no annotation is present, the method name will be used instead to map it.
        The interface will be interpreted as a mirror of the target object methods, and the optional Pass annotations will be honored.
        Note that such annotations will override any configuration set through the builder.

        Type Parameters:
        TYPE - the interface type.
        Parameters:
        itf - the token of the interface implemented by the return object.
        Returns:
        the proxy object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified class does not represent an interface.
        NullPointerException - if the specified class is null.

      • buildWrapper

        @Nonnull
<TYPE> TYPE buildWrapper(@Nonnull
                               Class<TYPE> itf)
        Returns a wrapper object enabling asynchronous calling of the target instance methods.

        The routines used for calling the methods will honor the attributes specified in any optional Bind, Timeout and Pass annotations.
        Note that such annotations will override any configuration set through the builder.

        The wrapping object is created through code generation based on the interfaces annotated with Wrap. The generated class will share the same package of the specified interface and will have a name of the type: JRoutine_<itf_simple_name>
        It is actually possible to avoid the use of reflection for the wrapper instantiation by explicitly calling the JRoutine_<itf_simple_name>.on() method. Note, however, that, since the class is generated, a generic IDE may highlight an error even if the compilation is successful.
        Note also that you'll need to enable annotation pre-processing by adding the processor package to the specific project dependencies.

        Type Parameters:
        TYPE - the interface type.
        Parameters:
        itf - the interface implemented by the return object.
        Returns:
        the wrapping object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified class does not represent an interface.
        NullPointerException - if the specified class is null.

      • buildWrapper

        @Nonnull

        Returns a wrapper object enabling asynchronous calling of the target instance methods.

        It is actually possible to avoid the use of reflection for the wrapper instantiation by explicitly calling the JRoutine_<itf_simple_name>.on() method. Note, however, that, since the class is generated, a generic IDE may highlight an error even if the compilation is successful.
        Note also that you'll need to enable annotation pre-processing by adding the processor package to the specific project dependencies.
